Articles.Content:
I got this idea from looking at my RB company, ULW, which is about to be deleted when RB is deleted. So, I thought it would be the perfect time to make a new steam locomotive, the 2-6-2! Train cars not included, unless you count the tender.

Anyways, here are some screenshots.
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/trmXPpe.png[/IMG]
This locomotive was originally intended to be a 4-6-2, but the wheels wouldn't cooperate, so I turned to a 2-6-2 system.
Later, the locomotive lost control and crashed into a fuel tank, destroying the boiler and flinging the cab from the chassis.
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/EiZpgwb.jpg[/IMG]
Oh, and don't turn the locomotive too quickly, otherwise it will tip over.
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/WcClGB5.png[/IMG]

You can download the 2-6-2 HERE:

[url]http://www./download/4p6ex3519za6r22/4-6-2.craft[/url] (WARNING: FRONT WHEELS MAY EXPLODE) Edited November 22, 2015 by UnionPacific1983WP
Fixed the 4-6-2 link

very nice, get the maritime boat pack for steam engines. also check out this train i made (150,000 tons)
[URL]http://imgur.com/7iXdICC[/URL]:cool: Edited November 25, 2015 by partyphoenix

From a failed attempt at flying a 2-6-2 to the island runway, I've found that the 2-6-2 makes a great one-way submarine!

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/9ceuryg.png[/IMG]

And the 4-6-2 that became an underwater base when it fell out the back of a Mallard:

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/DnhTQT4.png[/IMG]
This is 820 meters below the surface of the ocean.

I may be making a 2-6-6-2 or 2-8-8-2 soon....
